full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement**

**Subscription to Data, Analysis, and Reports Service**

Tender Reference Number: cb-890-83138334
Amendment Number: 3
Solicitation Number: NRCan-5000075500
Publication Date: 2024-02-07

**Submission Deadline and Evaluation Methodology**

The submission deadline for interested suppliers to submit a statement of capabilities is February 28, 2024, at 14:00 EST. The Canada will evaluate statements of capabilities based on their ability to meet the mandatory criteria outlined in the tender description.

**Title and Description of the Requirement**

The Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) is seeking a service provider to provide analysis on the global lithium-ion battery supply chains, battery raw materials supply chains, and battery and electric vehicle assembly. The successful supplier will provide data and analysis to NRCan on a monthly, quarterly, or annual basis, with forecasting reports for the remainder of the decade.

**Selection Criteria**

To be considered for this tender, suppliers must demonstrate that they possess an existing database containing the following information:

* Monthly price assessments for five main battery raw materials (lithium, cobalt, nickel, and graphite)
* Monthly global cathode and anode market assessments
* Quarterly global assessments of battery cell supply chains (2015-2040)
* Forecasts of recycled lithium, nickel, and cobalt until at least 2040
* Operational and planned recycling facilities
* Review and analysis of global recycling policies and regulations
* Supply/demand/price analysis and forecasts of rare earth and magnet markets

**Trade Agreements**

This procurement is subject to the following trade agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), World Trade Organization - Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP), Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), and others.

**Expression of Interest and Submissions**

Interested suppliers must submit a statement of capabilities to Mathew Star, Procurement Specialist, at mathew.star@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca, on or before February 28, 2024. Suppliers must clearly demonstrate their ability to meet the mandatory criteria outlined in the tender description. The contract value is estimated at $215,333 USD.

**Pre-identified Supplier**

Benchmark Mineral Intelligence (BMI) is the only known supplier that meets the mandatory criteria.
